title: Most city offices closed on first furlough day
text:
Most city offices closed on first furlough day Jackson city employees furloughed one day a month UPDATED 6:40 AM CDT Oct 16, 2015 
Jacksonâ€™s City Hall and most other city offices were closed Friday. Related Tip from Clinton pharmacy leads to... 
About 2,200 city employees were furloughed for the first time Friday. The furloughs will be in effect one Friday a month for the next two years as part of a money-saving plan initiated by Mayor Tony Yarber. 
Police and fire services will be operating and the Department of Public Works will call in staff if there is an emergency, city officials said. 
The furlough plan is estimated to save the city nearly $5 million, city officials said. Tags Furlough furlough day Jackson City of Jackson City Hall City offices Closed 
16 WAPT'S HADAS BROWN JOINS US LIVE FROM CITY HALL WITH THE DETAILS. THE CITY TELLS US OFFICES HERE WILL BE CLOSED TODAY, ERIN. WORKERS HERE ARE AMONG OVER 2000 -- FORCED TO TAKE THE DAY OFF. WE'LL SEE FURLOUGH FRIDAY'S IN THE CAPITAL CITY FOR THE NEXT TWO YEARS -- WHILE THE CITY TRIES TO CLOSE A 15 MILLION DOLLAR DEFICIT. J-P-D AND FIREFIGHTERS ARE EXEMPT-- BUT THE CHIEFS AND TOP COMMAND STAFF IN BOTH DEPARTMENTS ARE NOT. PUBLIC WORKS, THE AGENCY THAT REPAIRS WATER MAIN BREAKS, WILL ONLY BE AVAILABLE FOR EMERGENCIES. THE CITY COUNCIL APPROVED THE 382 MILLION DOLLAR BUDGET THAT INCLUDED THIS FURLOUGH PLAN LAST MONTH. IT ALSO CALLED FOR SOME LAYOFFS FOR A SMALL NUMBER OF CITY EMPLOYEES. OFFICIALS SAY THE FURLOUGHS COULD SAVE THE CITY MORE THAN 5-MILLION DOLLARS. LIVE IN JACKSON HADAS BROWN 16 WAPT NEWS NEW THIS MORNING... THE TRIAL FOR A LOCAL COUPLE ACCUSED OF
